intro: Psychotria macroserpens, commonly known as the "Cocaine plant" or "Coca plant," is a flowering plant native to the Andean regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dark green, glossy leaves and small, white flowers. The plant contains alkaloids, including cocaine, which are found primarily in its leaves. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in shaded, moist environments. Due to its psychoactive properties, it has significant ecological and legal implications.
